title: mpich picks up system libfabric

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

On ubuntu 20.04

```console
$ apt-get install libfabric-dev
$ spack install spfft +mpi ^mpich
```

When installing spfft, cmake complains:

```
The MPI test test_mpi for CXX in mode normal failed to compile with the following output:
Change Dir: /tmp/harmen/spack-stage/spack-stage-spfft-1.0.1-5w6kgf3aietp7tg6dskjj5e5mcio3mca/spack-build-5w6kgf3/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp

Run Build Command(s):/usr/bin/make -f Makefile cmTC_4de26/fast && /usr/bin/make  -f CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/build.make CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/build
make[1]: Entering directory '/tmp/harmen/spack-stage/spack-stage-spfft-1.0.1-5w6kgf3aietp7tg6dskjj5e5mcio3mca/spack-build-5w6kgf3/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp'
Building CXX object CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/test_mpi.cpp.o
/home/harmen/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++  -isystem /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/include -std=gnu++11 -o CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/test_mpi.cpp.o -c /tmp/harmen/spack-stage/spack-stage-spfft-1.0.1-5w6kgf3aietp7tg6dskjj5e5mcio3mca/spack-build-5w6kgf3/CMakeFiles/FindMPI/test_mpi.cpp
Linking CXX executable cmTC_4de26
/home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/cmake-3.20.0-4qidoyltbu3rmob2qg4zqipjiuepmrpo/bin/cmake -E cmake_link_script CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/link.txt --verbose=1
/home/harmen/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ -Wl,-rpath -Wl,/home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib -L/home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/hwloc-2.4.1-h55onjtrja246c2dccbqcgwn7mionf2r/lib CMakeFiles/cmTC_4de26.dir/test_mpi.cpp.o -o cmTC_4de26  -Wl,-rpath,/home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib/libmpicxx.so /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib/libmpi.so 
/usr/bin/ld: /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib/libmpi.so: undefined reference to `fi_dupinfo@FABRIC_1.3'
/usr/bin/ld: /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib/libmpi.so: undefined reference to `fi_getinfo@FABRIC_1.3'
/usr/bin/ld: /home/harmen/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen/gcc-8.4.0/mpich-3.4.1-dqwl5sfgnq2raufpppvmvvc72rwqmxgw/lib/libmpi.so: undefined reference to `fi_freeinfo@FABRIC_1.3'
```

After running `spack uninstall mpich` and `apt-get remove libfabric-dev` it does not complain.
